page.title: 05ROMANS AROUND BROUGH
page.content: WHEN THE ROMANS CAME TO BROUGH THEY BUILT A FORT CALLED VERTERAE.IT WAS THE REST PLACE FOR THE ROMANS AFTER THEY HAD THEIR LONG WALK FROM YORK TO SCOTLAND WITH THE LAST STOP AT MAIDEN CASTLE FORTLET ON STAINMORE.WHILE THE ROMANS STAYED IN BROUGH THEY BUILT MANY ROADS.THERE ARE TWO MAIN ROMAN ROADS THAT WE STILL USE TODAY.THE A685 STARTS AT BROUGH AND GOES THROUGH BROUGH SOWERBY.THE A66 WHICH STRETCHES FROM WORKINGTON TO MIDDLESBROUGH WAS NOT ALL BUILT BY THE ROMANS,THE PART THAT WAS STARTED FROM BOWES TO COUPLAND FORT. WHEN THE NORMANS CAME THEY BUILT A CASTLE IN ONE CORNER OF THE ROMAN FORT.THE CASTLE WAS VERY STRONG WITH WALLS 10 FEET THICK.IN 1314 ROBERT THE FIRST LORD CLIFFORD REPAIRED THE CASTLE BECAUSE THE SCOTS BURNED THE TIMBER. THE CASTLE IS NOW IN RUINS.
